data.title: Dropped in for dinner
data.text:
Checked reviews and had wonderful comments..
Not reality.  Super slow service due to understaffing.  Food was good but nothing to rave about.  Not high on the list of places to return.

data.title: Good BBQ but pricey
data.text: We were told that this BBQ was the best ever.  We did enjoy the briskit and ham, but it did not compare to what we get in Arkansas or Texas.  It was pricey.  We noticed that a lot of their menu items included hashbrowns on just about every BBQ plate.  That was weird.

data.title: delicious food & dog friendly patio
data.text: relaxing outdoor setting with water fountain in the background;  bbq and sauces are delicious  (try the burnt end sandwich and brisket salad)

data.title: Best Ever BBQ, Beer, Sports Bar
data.text: My wife and I thought the menu we'd seen via TripAdvisor looked very good. Our guess was weak -- it was Great! It took a long time to browse through the menu, and then to choose from a dozen possible wonderful items was even tougher. Fortunately, good service gave us the chance to sip beer (or, in my wife's case, a superb Cucumber Watermelon Lemonade). I had a hard time choosing, so our server (Marshall) brought me a small sample of each of the three most interesting on the beer menu. I chose a Red Rocket 16, a strong and tasty red ale. For food, I simply ordered Hand Grenades, stuffed jalapenos that were the best I'd ever had. My wife usually doesn't enjoy such jalapenos but said these were great for her. She ordered Cornbread Fritters and a Bowl of Chili Mac, knowing we'd take some home. The Chili Mac was superb; in my view, the chili with brisket was one of the best I've ever had. Both of us thought the fritters were also superb. Service was very good, with Marshall visiting us regularly to what more we might want and removing everything used as soon as we finished. The large room had six TVs turned to sports over the bar with others scattered around the walls so that it was easy to watch sports from any place inside. This was overall once of the best sports bars we had ever visited. We would have returned again the next day except that we found another Sauced will open in a month in Sacramento, so we can visit it there regularly.

data.title: Yummy In Your Tummy!
data.text: I just arrived in Petaluma to visit family and Sauced is where we had lunch today.  It has a large, attractive dining area with televisions all around the upper walls with just about every variety of sports in progress, for patron enjoyment.  The service was prompt and attentive.  The menu has a wonderful variety of barbecue meats, sauces, and side dishes.  At first look, it seemed a bit pricy but once I saw the serving sizes, the price became a non issue as the portions were huge.  My daughter has been there many times and since I wanted Nachos, she suggested that we share an order.  I really, really love a wonderful cheese sauce and a lot of it, she suggested that we get a side order.  We also got a side of sliced brisket.  Every item was fresh, hot, and oh so delicious!  There were no doggie bags to bring home as we finished everything while there.  We will be going again, before I return home, as there are just too many wonderful items that I want to try.  Delicious!

data.title: Great
data.text: Great atmosphere. Wonderful service. Had the burnt ends meal, little light on the meat, but the sides of sweet potato casserole and jalapeño cheesy grits were wonderful, meat was tasty just not enough of it for the price.

data.title: Disappointing!
data.text: This was a business dinner for about 10 of us.  The food was cold and not very flavorful.  I had the chicken nachos.  The  prices seemed high for the quality of the food.  I know this a trendy area, though.  The ambiance was fine, but the service was just so-so.  Next time I would pass on Sauced.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Thursday night and my family is hungry! The 3 teenage boys were quite satisfied with their entrees. My husband had the ribs and they were delicious. I had the pulled pork - also yummy. Prices were reasonable and the service was friendly and professional. Tip: free parking in the garage across the street.

data.title: So Smokin' Good ~ Did Not Disappoint!!
data.text: I was a little apprehensive because I've been disapointed with other BBQ restaurants. But here, it truly was SMOKIN' GOOD!! The three of of us ordered, shared & really enjoyed the "Hillbilly Philly", "Queban", "Mexicali", salads & Mac & Cheese!! The service was friendly, efficient and low key, the ambiance was casual and the whole restaurant was ringed with big screen TVs but it was quiet enough during our visit to talk business. The experience was pleasurable and one I hope enjoy again soon!!

data.title: Darn good bbq!
data.text: Our family enjoys Sauced ... a lot ... like at least twice a month a lot!  Especially great for sporting events our outdoor dining.  There is something for everybody on the menu and their interesting cocktails are always tasty!

data.title: Wow!  Very impressive AND fun!
data.text: We were there after 9 pm on a Saturday night after a day out of wine tasting and were able to walk here from the Metro Hotel.  We arrived and as we were being seated, the hostess asked if we'd like to play Drag Queen Bingo.  We said absolutely!  The Drag Queen was a hoot and really MADE the fun atmosphere while eating some YUMMY food!.  We ordered The Runny Elvis and Jive Chicken sandwiches and split them.    Both came with fries and BOTH ARE A MUST TRY.  My friend loved their pineapple cider but it was too sweet for my liking.  The service was excellent and the atmosphere was fun.  If we hadn't been so tired, we'd have stayed for the rest of the bingo rounds.  I've clicked below that the restaurant isn't appropriate for kids, however, I'm sure they don't do raunchy Drag Queen Bingo all the time, so you could probably take kids during the day.  I'd make sure to hustle them out before 9 pm on a Saturday night though.  That being said, we were delighted it was an adult oriented atmosphere and a lot of fun!

data.title: I was quite surprised
data.text:
The last time I had been to this location is was a pretty good Mexican restaurant. Much to my surprise we went there for that and discovered some good BBQ. Mind you, I have a commercial size offset smoker in my backyard, so I know what good BBQ is. 

The portions were generous, the service was really good and the location is great.

data.title: "Use sauce to cover up the taste."
data.text:
I'll admit that's my expectations weren't set very high going here.
With that in mind this was one of the worst from restaurant experiences I've ever had.
The top of the menu says that 20% is included for gratuity which is acceptable.
My lunch was $23.50 and iced tea $4 but it included gratuity.
The meat was inedible. The pulled pork tasted like it has been bathed in apple cider vinegar. The ribs were covered in a candied apple like crust. 
My salad was bland and served with the wrong dressing.
My sweet potato casserole was hot on one side cold on the other (microwaved)
As I was eating and after I had mentioned the meat was difficult to eat, I was asked if I would like a piece of cornbread.
At this point the waitress also told me that the meats would taste much better if I cover them in sauce like the name.
Is your food can't stand on its own without being covered up or hiding the flavors you've got a problem.
The piece of cornbread added $6 to my order.
My iced tea sat empty and I began looking for my waitress. I saw her with her coat leaving.
When the bill came the $27.50 plus the unexpected additional $6 totaled $33.50. This did not include the 20% gratuity that was in addition. Over $40 for bad food and bad service.
I treasure good barbecue and would love to see them succeed. Unfortunately Sauced is just bad all the way around.

data.title: Decent bbq, great location
data.text: This is our go-to place for bbq in Petaluma. They have a great selection of local beers and the place is always buzzing. BBQ is good, from what I have tasted: the ribs are pretty decent, not too smothered in sauce, the brisket is good and the burnt ends were really good. Also enjoyed the chicken. Overall, it's a decent BBQ place, hits the spot without setting the world alight.

data.title: Solid BBQ
data.text:
Fast and loud BBQ.  We arrived at 6:30 on a Friday and were told it would be 30 minutes for a table (we did NOT make reservations) but were thrilled when a large party cancelled and we were seated within 5 minutes.  

Ordered an appetizer: fried pickles and peppers.  
Wait time: 8 minutes
Details: this was perfect for us, got our taste buds ready.  The mix of these jalapenos and pickles with ranch dressing were fun and continued to serve as a side dish throughout our meal.  

Dinner order: 2 Meat (burnt ends and pulled pork) 
Sides: sour apple slaw and stoneground jalapeno cheese grits
Wait time: 11 minutes (3 minutes after the appetizer)
Details: YUM!  Burnt ends were rich and saucy, pulled pork had a nice smoke ring was juicy and flavorful.  For us it was plenty of food and we left with pulled pork and grits, which I loved for breakfast.

data.title: For a young crowd
data.text: If you like noisy and a young vibe this is your spot.  This was formerly Tres Hombre's Mexican food.  It serves pulled pork and other pork type dishes.and then sauces that you put on.  It's tasty but I prefer quieter venues because it can be a bit difficult to chat over the voices.

data.title: Can't wait to go back
data.text: We were so excited to try this place so we ordered a lot more than we could eat. The service was great! Our server took our drink order and while giving us her recommendations our drinks were served by another server, and it was busy. We had the brisket, pulled pork sandwich. Both were good and the bbq sauces were yummy. But the appetizers we got were amazing and huge portions. Qe got the tater tot appetizer and the nachos. Can't wait to go back and try some other items.

data.title: Best Chili EVER!
data.text: We had the Fried pickles and peppers and they were so delicious, a little kick but not too hot.  Then we both had the Brisket Chili.  Honestly the best chili I have ever had.  It was sweet, yet spicy and hardy.  They served it with corn bread which had corn in it and added to the flavor.  We were pleasantly surprised it was so good.  They had a great selections of beer and whiskey's.  I saw a few whiskeys I hadn't seen since a trip to Tennessee.  We had a great lunch.

data.title: Was better the first time
data.text:
My family and I went a few months ago and everything was great. Good food, good service, and great atmosphere. Yes it is a little pricey but it was worth it.

We just went back a few nights ago and were a little upset they now put a 20% gratuity on EVERY check and they tax you on it. I normally tip that much anyway but I don't like being forced to. Since the servers are now guaranteed that tip, service of course has gone down. Food is still good but we most likely won't go back.

data.title: Very Tasty BBQ
data.text: Very Tasty BBQ, I eat here when I want bbq. good food, great beer selection, my only complaint is with the tin roof inside it is very loud.
